content: Can you provide an Excel table that lists the three fundamental particles of an atom, along with their respective properties such as mass, charge, and location within the atom?

Certainly! Below is an outline of an Excel table that lists the three fundamental particles of an atom along with their respective properties:

| Particle   | Mass (kg)           | Charge (C)    | Location       |
|------------|---------------------|---------------|----------------|
| Proton     | \(1.6726 \times 10^{-27}\) | \(+1.602 \times 10^{-19}\) | Nucleus        |
| Neutron    | \(1.6750 \times 10^{-27}\) | 0             | Nucleus        |
| Electron   | \(9.1094 \times 10^{-31}\) | \(-1.602 \times 10^{-19}\) | Electron cloud |

You can create this table in Excel by entering the headers in the first row and filling in the details as shown above in the subsequent rows.
